# The `LandingPadInst` Class Reference

<DoxygenPage pluginConfig={pluginConfig}>

The landingpad instruction holds all of the information necessary to generate correct exception handling. <a href="#details">More...</a>

## Description {#details}

The landingpad instruction holds all of the information necessary to generate correct exception handling.

The landingpad instruction cannot be moved from the top of a landing pad block, which itself is accessible only from the &#39;unwind&#39; edge of an invoke. This uses the SubclassData field in <a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/value">Value</a> to store whether or not the landingpad is a cleanup.

Definition at line 2840 of file <a href="/docs/api/files/include/include/llvm/include/llvm/ir/instructions-h">Instructions.h</a>.

<MemberDefinition
  prototype="bool llvm::LandingPadInst::isCleanup () const"
  labels = {["inline"]}>
Return &#39;true&#39; if this landingpad instruction is a cleanup.

I.e., it should be run when unwinding even if its landing pad doesn&#39;t catch the exception.

Definition at line <a href="/docs/api/files/include/include/llvm/include/llvm/ir/instructions-h/#l02885">2885</a> of file <a href="/docs/api/files/include/include/llvm/include/llvm/ir/instructions-h">Instructions.h</a>.

### init() {#affb3646a0116627e436c567d83f65cac}

NumOperands is the number actually in use.
